CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 30, 1962, page 9 reads: "Cal and Family: Calvin Cunningham adjusts Cal Jr.'s tie, while Betty, his pretty wife, beams on daughter Gail, as proud 10 years old. A typical handsome American family from Pittsburgh, Pa."  The author of the article was Toki S. Johnson, and described Calvin Cunningham worked for Lutz' Meat Market on Centre Avenue since he was a boy and now manages the store when the owner, Carl Lutz, is away. The location is the living room of their home on Whiteside Road in Hill District. Lutz Meat Market was located at 2145 Centre Avenue, at intersection of Elmore Street, Hill District. Calvin Cunningham died suddenly in 1969.
TitMainTitle: Cunningham family portrait with Betty Shelton Cunningham and Calvin Cunningham, their daughter Gail holding Better Homes and Gardens magazine, and son Calvin Jr., in the living room of their home on Whiteside Road, Hill District
